item.title: Example - Python to IDL Bridge
item.description:
The Python to IDL bridge provides a mechanism for calling IDL code from Python[1]. 

from idlpy import IDL
  • Get the file, read it as Raster and view it in ENVI
e = IDL.ENVI() # The Envi window will be popped out
File = "C:\\Program Files\\Exelis53\\envi53\\data\\qb_boulder_msi"
raster1 = e.OpenRaster(File)
view1 = e.GetView()
layer1 = view1.CreateLayer(raster1)
  • Raster Convert to Array. In this section, How to put parameters to the GetData() method?
    an alternative way to subset the original data is to process the output 'data', and its type is numpy.ndarray.
#data = raster1.GetData("BANDS=[0], SUB_RECT=[100,449,550,899]") #didn't work
data = raster1.GetData()
  • Array to Raster
new_raster = IDL.ENVIRaster(data)
new_raster.save()
  • Perform MNF Transform
Task = IDL.ENVITask('ForwardMNFTransform') 
Task.INPUT_RASTER = new_raster 
Task.OUTPUT_RASTER_URI = e.GetTemporaryFilename() 
Task.Execute()
  • View the MNF result in ENVI
DataColl = e.Data
DataColl.Add(Task.Output_Raster)
View1 = e.GetView()
Layer1 = View1.CreateLayer(Task.Output_Raster)
  • References

1.http://www.exelisvis.com/docs/pythontoidl.html

item.title: Example - MNF Transform using IDL
item.description:
Ipython + IDL environment setup [1]

the following codes were written in Ipython, using ENVI API...

  • Get the file, read it as Raster and view it in ENVI
e = ENVI()
file1 = FILEPATH('qb_boulder_msi', ROOT_DIR=e.ROOT_DIR, $
  SUBDIRECTORY = ['data'])
raster1 = e.OpenRaster(file1)
view1 = e.GetView()
layer1 = view1.CreateLayer(raster1)
  • Get the subset and return an Array
data = raster1.GetData(BANDS=[0,1,2,3], SUB_RECT=[100,449,550,899])
  • Convert Array to Raster 
new_raster = ENVIRaster(data)
new_raster.Save
  • Perform MNF Transform on the subset data
Task = ENVITask('ForwardMNFTransform') 
Task.INPUT_RASTER = new_raster 
Task.OUTPUT_RASTER_URI = e.GetTemporaryFilename() 
Task.Execute
  • View the MNF result in ENVI
DataColl = e.Data

; Add the output to the data collection
DataColl.Add, Task.Output_Raster

; Display the result
View1 = e.GetView()
Layer1 = View1.CreateLayer(Task.Output_Raster)
  • References:
  1. https://www.exelisvis.com/docs/idl_kernel.html
  2. https://www.exelisvis.com/docs/envi__openraster.html
  3. http://www.exelisvis.com/docs/enviRaster__GetData.html
  4. https://www.exelisvis.com/docs/enviforwardmnftransformtask.html
